heading: an e-felony?
subheading: the parents of a family that officials in alliance, ohio have been watching for years are being accused of selling their 14-year-old son over the internet, the associated press reports. social workers have complained about the family's squalid living conditions for years, but it took the boy's accusation that he was sold to a virginia man for us$400 to trigger some action. although no criminal charges have been filed, a judge has removed the couple's six children -- ranging in age from 11 months to 14 years old -- from their custody while the fbi conducts an investigation.
author: wired staff
text: the parents of a family that officials in alliance, ohio have been watching for years are being accused of selling their 14-year-old son over the internet, the associated press reports. social workers have complained about the family's squalid living conditions for years, but it took the boy's accusation that he was sold to a virginia man for us$400 to trigger some action. although no criminal charges have been filed, a judge has removed the couple's six children -- ranging in age from 11 months to 14 years old -- from their custody while the fbi conducts an investigation.
